title: Make a Simple Club
brief: Create a basic field-expedient club for defense and extending your reach.
steps: Step 1: Find a staff or branch that is short enough to swing easily but long enough to damage your target.
Step 2: Ensure the diameter fits comfortably in your palm but isn't so thin it will break on impact.
Step 3: Look for straight-grained hardwood if available for maximum durability.
Step 4: Test the club's weight and balance by swinging it a few times.
warnings: Do not use clubs against armed enemies - they only extend your reach beyond fingertips.
Avoid wood that is too thin as it will break upon impact.
Clubs are for holding and swinging, not throwing.
